summary: This bill (HR 1948) authorizes the International Boundary and Water Commission (IBWC) to accept funds from federal and non-federal entities for activities related to wastewater treatment, water conservation, and flood control works. The bill outlines how these funds are to be managed, including deposit into a specific Treasury account.  It also sets limitations on reimbursement to non-federal entities and restricts funding from certain foreign entities. The IBWC is required to submit a yearly report detailing the use of these funds and associated costs. The bill's definition section clarifies terminology.
